original_title: The Divine River: Ceremonial Pageantry in the Sahel
overview: Condensed from 40 hours of footage shot between 2007 and 2012, The Divine River is an exhilarating, hallucinatory, harrowing record of music, ritual, life and landscape along the Niger River—which the Tuareg call Egerew n-Igerewen, or "River of Rivers"— as it winds through Mali and the Republic of Niger.
title: The Divine River: Ceremonial Pageantry in the Sahel
